{"id":1475686896,"question_id":2891,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"1 month, 4 weeks","timestamp":1733877278,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1475686896/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Maximum Beauty of an Array After Applying Operation","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    int maximumBeauty(vector<int>& nums, int k) {\n        int n = nums.size();\n        if(n==1)\n            return 1;\n        int maxBeauty = 0;\n        int maxValue;\n        for(int num:nums)\n            maxValue = max(maxValue, num);\n        vector<int> count(maxValue+1, 0);\n        for(int num:nums) { //update the count array for each value's range [val-k, val+k]\n            count[max(num-k, 0)]++; \n            if(num+k+1<maxValue)\n                count[num+k+1]--; //decrement after the range.\n        }\n        int curSum = 0;\n        for(int val:count) {\n            curSum += val;\n            maxBeauty = max(maxBeauty, curSum);\n        };\n        return maxBeauty;\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"maximum-beauty-of-an-array-after-applying-operation","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
